basics.name: Olivia Wang
basics.summary: Currently a PhD student at UC Santa Cruz, researching Human-centered Explainable AI, Neuro-symbolic AI, and the interdisciplinary study of law and AI. Previously a Software Engineer at VMware.

education.area: Ph.D in Computer Science and Engineering
B.S. in Management Information Systems, Minor in Computer Science

publications.title: Follow My Lead: Logical Fallacy Classification with Knowledge-Augmented LLMs
publications.authors: Wang, O. P., Bansal, T., Bai, R., Chui, E. M., & Gilpin, L. H.
publications.venue: The Twelfth Annual Conference on Advances in Cognitive Systems
publications.citation: Wang, O. P., Bansal, T., Bai, R., Chui, E. M., & Gilpin, L. H. (2025). Follow My Lead: Logical Fallacy Classification with Knowledge-Augmented LLMs. arXiv preprint arXiv:2510.09970.
publications.excerpt: This paper applied the ideologies from decision procedure by breaking down the complex logical fallacy description into atomic questions that can be answered with "yes" or "no". This paper intends to explore whether we could enforce LLMs to perform system 2 thinking in this way. This paper was accepted by The Twelfth Annual Conference on Advances in Cognitive Systems, and Bay Area Machine Learning Symposium for poster presentation
